page.title: 16CASTLE FIELDS:HIGHAM FERRERS
page.content:
Castle Fields is a recreation ground on the site of the Coney-garth or Rabbit Warren and Fishponds, which provided food for the nearby Castle.
The area which had become overgrown with bushes etc. was tidied up in 1983. On the 30th May 1985 the fair came to Castle Fields for three days. A survey about Higham fair was carried out by pupils of the Ferrers School. They asked a boy and girl from each class to give their thoughts on the fair.
The fair was most popular with the 11-13 year olds. The older pupils thought the fair should have more rides and stalls. Some of the rides were the Orbitor, Dodgems, Dive Bomber, a Ferris Wheel and the Hustler. People felt that the fair was not exciting enough, and that it did not stay long enough.
